bugs.title: CVE-2019-1010224 aubio: null pointer dereference in component onset

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-1010224 aubio: null pointer dereference in component onset

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in aubio 0.4.8 and earlier is affected by: null pointer. The impact is: crash (DoS). The component is: onset.

Reference:
https://github.com/aubio/aubio/blob/0.4.8/src/onset/onset.c#L59
https://github.com/aubio/aubio/commit/e4e0861cffbc8d3a53dcd18f9ae85797690d67c7

Created aubio tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1735587]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next

the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1735586,1735587

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2019-1010223 aubio: buffer overflow in component tempo

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-1010223 aubio: buffer overflow in component tempo

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in aubio 0.4.8 and earlier is affected by: Buffer Overflow. The impact is: buffer overflow in strcpy. The component is: tempo.

Reference:
https://github.com/aubio/aubio/blob/0.4.8/src/tempo/tempo.c#L208
https://github.com/aubio/aubio/commit/b1559f4c9ce2b304d8d27ffdc7128b6795ca82e5

Created aubio tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1735589]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-1010222 aubio: null pointer dereference in component filterbank

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-1010222 aubio: null pointer dereference in component filterbank

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in aubio 0.4.8 and earlier is affected by: null pointer. The impact is: crash. The component is: filterbank. The attack vector is: pass invalid arguments to new_aubio_filterbank.

Reference:
https://github.com/aubio/aubio/blob/0.4.8/src/spectral/mfcc.c#L79
https://github.com/aubio/aubio/commit/eda95c9c22b4f0b466ae94c4708765eaae6e709e

Created aubio tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1735592]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.
